outputs.output_descr: Disaster and climate risk reduction capacities in Uzbekistan are strengthened to address multi-faceted disaster risks in a gender sensitive manner by 2014. This shall be achieved through fulfilling the following: (i) Provide technical assistance to the Ministry of Emergency Situations to strengthen its role as the main disaster preparedness and response agency in Uzbekistan; (ii) Mobilize disaster risk reduction stakeholders in the public, private and civil society sectors to create effective training and advocacy tools; (iii) Support the Academy of Science to provide Government disaster risk planners with timely and relevant scientific data to create effective disaster preparedness, mitigation, response, early recovery, reconstruction and rehabilitation plans; (iv) Support United Nations Country Team in Uzbekistan to prepare a unified strategy for disaster management of any natural or human-induced catastrophic event that overwhelms the government's capacity to respond to a humanitarian crisis.

project_descr: The project objective is to assist relevant institutions in creating sustainable mechanism for disaster risk reduction in Uzbekistan.
